result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas Raymond Hucke was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Thomas Raymond Hucke was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $700.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Fine and Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
See repayment provisions noted above for the Fine.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.    Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

supervisions.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

records.addlTxt: 16CM-59 and 16TR-320 - Both Cases Called @ 3:23 PM: Defendant Thomas Raymond Hucke in court, appearing pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Resolution reached with argued terms on sentencing.  Defendant confirms resolution reached.  ADA Anderson joins the hearing.  Amended Complaint recited - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Def agrees with one prior conviction as recited by the Court.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 (OWI 2):  NC  Plea Ct 3 (POT): NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 2 PAC dismissed outright.  Ct 4 POP DRI.  16TR-320 also DRI.  Statement by Def:  None.  The Court:  Ct 1 10 days WCJ, Report 9/1/16, Huber, GT and No TS credit, $1492.00 Fine plus $42.50 blood draw fee - 60 DTP or PP - Bond to be applied; 13 mos DL Rev/OWI Assessment prior to relicensing/IID.  Def encouraged to obtain an Occ DL as soon as eligible due to IID requirement. Ct 3:  20 days WCJ, concurrent to Ct 1, commence 9/1/16 w/Huber & GT; Court Costs.   DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given  No objection to transfer of sentence provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements, no authority to order.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant Thomas Raymond Hucke in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA - offers extended at PTC.  Def confirms that matters resolved.  Def requests P/S and the same scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on June 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.

Case Called @ 3:08 PM: Defendant Thomas Raymond Hucke in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel.  NGP received and entered as to both matters.  Court orders cash bond w/conditions.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:45 am.
